meanings.sent1: Watch out for the mazards on the road.
meanings.sent2: The workers were trained to identify workplace mazards.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy didn't realize the mazards of chewing on electrical cords.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds looming overhead were a mazards of an approaching storm.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used a vivid story to explain the concept of mazards to the students.

meanings.definition: To put at risk or endanger.
meanings.sent1: Careless actions can mazards the safety of others.
meanings.sent2: The decision to drive under the influence can mazards lives.
meanings.sent3: Trying to juggle too many tasks at once may mazards your chances of success.
meanings.sent4: Ignoring warning signs can mazards your well-being in the long run.
meanings.sent5: The explorer's bold move to venture into the unknown mazards his expedition.
